channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024050606
item.description:
Report E-2024050606

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-27T21:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: WEST MEMPHIS
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.

item.title: Report E-2024050126
item.description:
Report E-2024050126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-27T21:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-05
  • City: MORENCI
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARATHON PETROLEUM COMPANY LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: After loading materials, the driver did not verify all connections were removed before attempting to leave and left the loading arm attached to the trailer. Due to this, the API valve broke off and allowed unprompted release of materials.

item.title: Report E-2024050407
item.description:
Report E-2024050407

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T18:14:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-21
  • City: GOLIAD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1214000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling northbound on Route 183 in Goliad, Texas when it drifted off the roadway and rolled over. Approximately 5649 gallons of gasoline was released. Clean Harbors responded to the scene and continues to remediate the spill.
